column4: with all jokes aside, can someone guide me on how to repair an upgrade to 9.04? my laptop froze in the midpoint of installing (it downloaded everything prior) and now i am stuck at a root prompt, a few lines above it says /dev/sda2 contains a file system with errors, check forced. /dev/sda2:unexpected inconsistency fun fsck manually. fsck died with exit status 4. checking drive/dev/sda2: 4% 5/75. an automatic file system check of the roo
I'd suggest to make a backup, including a list of installed packages and reinstall. if you want the fastest way
no , see i was doing the update-upgrade from update manager in ubuntu 8.10
and it froze during the installation process
yes I understood that. seems something gone wrong
i dont care if settings over ubuntu are written over.. i am more worried about my windows partition being lost somehow
can i repair what i had downloaded from the root prompt i am at?
yes you could. but that would cost you quite some time
L what do u mean by time?
lots of hours

ah znh there's no command to come back from a failed installation crash? :( so what is the easiest way? please keep in mind, i have 2 very important partitions not related to ubuntu, those are the last two, it goes ubuntu, fat32, windows xp.
also znh i dont mind about the data on the ubuntu partition - there's really nothing saved on there.
I've never heard of such command. The easiest way would be to reinstall ubuntu and keep in mind that other partitions dont get overwritten
so i need to download a live cd then huh? i dont have a blank cdr, i can use a dvdr?
i also have a usb
unsure, perhaps the channel knows for sure
can i download the ubuntu 9.04 to a live cd?
i mean can i burn to a dvd
to boot and install from
ok thanks VisitorQ - burning the image to dvd w/ imgburn
- i downloaded the 9.04 desktop file and am burning the image now to dvd
allright
